TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

This might be a very stupid question, but is there any tutorial on how to install this scatterer mod? I have never really understood and got it right when trying to download these texture mods? Cheers!
My RAM!

Like any other mod actually; got to where you have installed your game (Steam default .../steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program), open the archived file of the mod which in this case is Scatterer and drop the scatterer map in you GameData folder. Presto! You got some wicked graphics overhaul!

One word of warning though: This version of Scatterer isn't yet compatible with the recent version of KSP. Wait until this mod is updated.

Presto! You got some wicked graphics overhaul!

I actually still use the 1.2.2 version of the KSP just because it's more stable with mods and for me it's a f\*\*\*ng pain in the ass to reinstall all mods which most of them arent even compatible with the newest version. Oh boy wouldnt steam workshop be sooooo easy now right?

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-31T20:43:51Z" title="05/31/2017 08:43  PM" data-short="7 yr">May 31, 2017</time> by MultiFrapser**
  
Flipping?!?!

Hello once again. What did you mean with the scatterer map? I do not have anything like that in my scatterer mod files? I tried to place the files in the Gamedata\scatterer\config files into the KSP GameData folder but still nothing even happens if I try to open the mod menu (ALT+F10 or ALT+F11)

In the scatterer zip file is a map called GameData. Just copy it in your Kerbal Space Program folder. When installed correctly this order of folders must exist: .../steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/GameData/scatterer.

> 
> 
> 29 minutes ago, mafkaas300 said:
> 
> 
> In the scatterer zip file is a map called GameData. Just copy it in your Kerbal Space Program folder. When installed correctly this order of folders must exist: .../steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/GameData/scatterer.
> 

Ah ok now it works! Thank you very much, only problem is that I can not seem to figure out how to add clouds? Do you know how to get clouds, otherwise the graphics look very nice!

I personally use Stock Visual Enhancement but I advise you to just search a bit for something that best suit your needs (and ease of installation of the mods).

There are mods which just add clouds but also mods that add visual weather like lightning and planetary storms.

I chose SVE because it caused me the least problems but that was a while ago. Since I am waiting on just a few mods to make the jump to 1.3 I might be trying to install a few more in-depth visual mods.

They are mostly hard to install because of the preferences you would like yourself. While some of the mods seem very complicated to install they mostly just need to get in the .../Kerbal Space Program/GameData/[Mod name] hierarchy just like Scatterer and everything should work well (hopefully).

Everything in SVE apart from scatterer is updated for 1.3, but scatterer works fine with only the occasional weird event. It's hard to describe the eerie sci-fi vibe I got when I was landing on The Mun and these tiles silently lifted up and floated gently away, it was like reliving 2001 a space odyssey. Sometimes I want Blackrack to keep some of these things as Easter eggs. Except I know someone would come in here and complain in a rude way making Blackrack less likely to want to contribute to our enjoyment of the game.

![7HSs1LO.png](http://i.imgur.com/7HSs1LO.png)

When I first saw the tiles, I was already well aware of the issue from the countless reports that popped up on SVE, <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>, Kopernicus, and Scatterer's thread, but that didn't keep me from enjoying the experience! It was like my Kerbals were asleep and part of an experiment or simulation that was failing somewhere in reality.
Maybe they experienced the different forms of universes and laws of physics? ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Well it was indeed quite the event when the Mun broke up in several tiles and broke reality. I didn't which of the many tiles were landable until I crashed into the tileless section.

It brings a whole new level to the game!

Here's a quick FIY: I still need a bit more experimentation, but I suspect now that this *new feature* might be connected to the ocean shaders. (i.e. I could not reproduce the tiles when ocean shaders were dissabled) Like I said, need more experiments to be absolutely sure though.
